questions.subject: Humanities(Social_Studies)
questions.question: Study Source A.  Why is this poster published?  Explain your answer.

questions.subject: Humanities(Social_Studies)
questions.question: Study Source B. How useful is source as evidence about elderly care? Explain your answer.

questions.subject: Humanities(Social_Studies)
questions.question: Study Sources C and D. How far are they similar? Explain your answer.

questions.subject: Humanities(Social_Studies)
questions.question: Study Source E. Are you surprised by this source? Explain your answer

questions.subject: Humanities(Social_Studies)
questions.question: “The elderly in Singapore are neglected.” Using sources in this case study, explain how far you would agree with this statement.

questions.subject: Humanities(Social_Studies)
questions.question: Extract 1 illustrates how different people react to what is meant to be a common good for society. In your opinion, why is it difficult to decide on what is good for society? Explain your answer giving two reasons.

questions.subject: Humanities(Social_Studies)
questions.question: Extracts 2 and 3 reflect on how both individuals and organised groups have a part to play in making improvements to society. Do you think individuals are better than organised groups in making improvements to society? Explain your answer
